cpic_guidelines.clinical_guidance: Intermediate metabolizers have reduced morphine formation (10-20% reduction). Consider higher doses or shorter intervals.

clinical_recommendation.summary: Consider higher than normal dose or shorter dosing intervals; pain response-driven titration
clinical_recommendation.dosing: 120-150% of standard dose may be needed
clinical_recommendation.monitoring: Assess pain control; titrate dose based on response (may need 30-60 mg per dose)

llm_generated_explanation.summary: CYP2D6 IM phenotype suggests reduced codeine-to-morphine conversion
llm_generated_explanation.clinical_impact: CYP2D6 (IM): Adjust dosage - 20% increased analgesic requirements

cpic_guidelines.clinical_guidance: CYP2C9 *1/*2 (Intermediate metabolizer): 5-7 mg/day initial dose. VKORC1 not available in this test profile.

clinical_recommendation.summary: Reduce initial dose to 5-7 mg daily; adjust based on INR response. More frequent INR monitoring required.
clinical_recommendation.monitoring: INR at baseline, 2-7 days, weekly x 1-2 weeks, then every 1-4 weeks. Target INR 2.0-3.0

llm_generated_explanation.summary: CYP2C9 IM phenotype strongly predicts reduced warfarin metabolism
llm_generated_explanation.clinical_impact: CYP2C9 (IM): Reduce dose 30-40% | Higher sensitivity to warfarin

cpic_guidelines.clinical_guidance: CYP2C19 *1/*2 (Intermediate metabolizer): Reduced antiplatelet effect; may not achieve therapeutic levels.

clinical_recommendation.summary: Consider alternative antiplatelet (prasugrel 5-10 mg or ticagrelor 60-90 mg) OR increase clopidogrel dose
clinical_recommendation.dosing: Increase to 600 mg loading dose, 150 mg daily maintenance (vs standard 300/75 mg)
clinical_recommendation.monitoring: Heightened risk for stent thrombosis; assess response; consider platelet function testing

llm_generated_explanation.summary: CYP2C19 IM phenotype results in suboptimal clopidogrel activation
llm_generated_explanation.clinical_impact: CYP2C19 (IM): Reduced antiplatelet effect - alternative P2Y12 inhibitor preferred

cpic_guidelines.clinical_guidance: SLCO1B1 *1/*2 (Decreased function): Increased simvastatin concentrations and myopathy risk. Reduce dose or use alternative.

clinical_recommendation.summary: Reduce simvastatin dose to 5 mg daily maximum; consider pravastatin or rosuvastatin (not SLCO1B1 substrates)
clinical_recommendation.monitoring: Assess muscle symptoms (pain, weakness, dark urine); measure CK baseline; LFTs at baseline and 12 weeks

llm_generated_explanation.summary: SLCO1B1 decreased function impairs simvastatin hepatic uptake
llm_generated_explanation.clinical_impact: SLCO1B1 (*1/*2): 4-fold increased simvastatin levels - myopathy and rhabdomyolysis risk

cpic_guidelines.clinical_guidance: TPMT *1/*2 (Intermediate activity): Increased risk of 6-TGN accumulation and bone marrow toxicity. Reduce dose 25-50%.

clinical_recommendation.summary: Reduce standard azathioprine dose by 25-50%; start with 0.5-1 mg/kg/day (vs 1-2.5 mg/kg standard)
clinical_recommendation.dosing: 50% dose reduction (e.g., 25 mg daily instead of 50 mg)
clinical_recommendation.monitoring: CBC (white blood cell count, hemoglobin, platelets) weekly x 4-6 weeks, then every 2 weeks. Watch for infections, anemia, bleeding

llm_generated_explanation.summary: TPMT intermediate activity leads to increased 6-TGN metabolite accumulation
llm_generated_explanation.clinical_impact: TPMT (IM): Bone marrow toxicity risk - mandatory dose reduction

cpic_guidelines.clinical_guidance: DPYD *1/*2 (Decreased activity): Reduced fluorouracil clearance; significantly increased toxicity risk (neutropenia, mucositis, diarrhea).

clinical_recommendation.summary: Reduce fluorouracil dose by 25-50%; start with lower dose and titrate slowly based on tolerance
clinical_recommendation.dosing: 50% dose reduction (e.g., 500 mg/m² instead of 1000 mg/m² daily)
clinical_recommendation.monitoring: Frequent CBC monitoring; watch closely for severe neutropenia, mucositis grade 3+, diarrhea. Consider alternative chemotherapy if severe toxicity

llm_generated_explanation.summary: DPYD decreased activity impairs fluorouracil metabolism and clearance
llm_generated_explanation.clinical_impact: DPYD (*1/*2): Severe toxicity risk - mandatory dose reduction and intensive monitoring
